Q_NAME: Number of swaps required in Selection Sort
Q_DESC:
Given a list of numbers, you have to perform Selection Sort on the given numbers. You have to find how many swaps will be performed during the sorting process. You have to print the number of swaps that took place in the result. You will be given T test cases and each test case will have N numbers that need to be sorted. 

Input:
First line of the input contains T the number of test cases, the next line contains N the number of elements in the first test case. Following that line there are N space separated numbers that have to sorted.

Output:
Total number of swaps required to sort the given list of numbers in each test case. Each output for each of the different test cases will be printed on a separate line.

Constaints:
1=T=10
1=N=100
1=A[i]=100
